page.title: 11TEMPLE NORMANTON SCHOOL.
page.content: Temple Normanton is a small village with an equally small school. On roll are only 35 children who come from a wide catchment area. The children are divided into two classes. The infant children share a room and the juniors another. So in each class there is a wide spread of age and ability. The small number of children allows the staff to develop an informal approach and a happy working relation- ship is achieved. However, the small number of pupils means that sport and other competetive activities are restricted. Developing music in the school is a problem. Concerts are limited. Even choosing a book to read to the class is difficult for the teacher. The small village school is attractive and spacious with its own hall, dining room, canteen and spare classrooms.
